result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl G. Derby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carl G. Derby is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carl G. Derby was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug - If needed, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.

records.addlTxt: For Ct 1 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Caspari.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent to 15CF586; credit for 23 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Caspari.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  STC is adjourned from 2/1/16 at 8:30am to 2/22/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
